intro: Watsonia minima, commonly known as the dwarf Watsonia, is a compact, evergreen perennial native to South Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, cone-shaped inflorescences with bright red or orange flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained conditions. Watsonia minima is a popular choice for rock gardens and containers due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
